alert.note: Alert for Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Nelson; Steele (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:13PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Polk, Grand Forks, east central Nelson, southeastern Walsh and northeastern Steele Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kempton, or 29 miles west of Grand Forks, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kempton around 615 PM CDT. Larimore around 620 PM CDT. Arvilla around 625 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Grand Forks AFB, Emerado, Honeyford and Mekinock. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 134 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern North Dakota.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Nelson; Steele
